item.title: Sweep Control v1.0.0.5
item.description:
Product: Sweep Control v1.0.0.5
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 17 Nov 2023 20:03:04 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: [SweepControl.lvclass]
- Sweep Control.vi:
- Sequencer for stepping multiple parameters. Calls VIs in Transport.lvclass
- Continuous B sweep.vi:
- Sweep B continuously while asynchronously calling VIs in Transport.lvclass

Release Notes: SweepControl.lvclass
- first build as stand-alone package
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Transport v1.7.0.4
item.description:
Product: Transport v1.7.0.4
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 17 Nov 2023 17:19:16 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Transport.lvclass]
Basic transport measurments:
- Lockin vs time (Lockin_time.vi)
- Lockin Sweep Mode (Lockin_sweep.vi)

Release Notes: [1.7.0]
- Issue #72: display intermittent values in Lockin_Sweep
- Issue #75: R and G calculations are more flexible
- Update Lockin_time and Lockin_sweep to handle vector magnet instruments
- Update Lockin_sweep to more frequently poll instruments for their status
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Control Experiment v1.0.0.2
item.description:
Product: Control Experiment v1.0.0.2
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 17 Nov 2023 16:12:17 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
- Control Experiment.vi
- provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device
- record how the lockin is connected to the device
- configure the Krohn Hite amplifier
- set the base path for saving data
- configure peripheral instruments
- APIs for recording sample data, instrument status

Release Notes: [1.0.0]
- The class was previously included in the Transport package. It has now been split into it's own package
- Issue #60: New Lockin API allows quicker and better error handling if Lock-In is not running
- Issue #74: fix issue with KH address in Control Experiment
- Issue #78: Fix issues with saving and loading instruments in Load Instrument Classes
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: LEIDEN FP v4.57.2.2
item.description:
Product: LEIDEN FP v4.57.2.2
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Mon, 23 Oct 2023 16:08:51 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Tools used by LevyLab to interact with Leiden Front Panel (FP)
API:
Push Button (Start, 3He, 4He, Normal, Recovery, Auto, Reset, LED Test)
Set Mode (Auto Off, Start, Condense 3He, Condense 4He, Normal Circulation, Recovery)
Get Mode

Release Notes: First build

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.13.0.10
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.13.0.10
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 29 Sep 2023 09:36:40 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.13.0]
- Issue #90: update pgsql connection load/save
- Issue #89: Remove linking to ZMQ example VIs
- Issue #88: Variant to LV Data.vim no longer traps incoming errors
- Issue #86:
- Wait for Magnet Setpoint.vi will stop on Finished? == True from Get Magnet.vi. It is the responsibility of the overriding instrument to control Finished?
- Wait for Temperature Setpoint.vi has a new control, tolerance. The overriding instrument API will need to be updated
- Issue #84, #26:
- Communication with instrument hardware should happen in the child process.vi. Handle Command can parse and discriminate commands, but it should forward messagses using Instrument:MessageToProcess.vi. The chil will respond with child:MessageToProcess.
- Open and Close are <b>disabled</b> in the instrument:process.vi. If you need this methods please implement them in the child's process.vi
- Issue #82: Change "Create Server SMO.vi" to make easier to call in non-Instrument Framework projects
- Issue #32: finalize configuration with multiple sections
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: LV-Data v3.7.0.2
item.description:
Product: LV-Data v3.7.0.2
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 29 Sep 2023 08:28:50 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Collection of VIs to write and read TDMS, Igor Text Files (*.itx), text-based spreadsheet data files (*.dat), postgreSQL. Tools are also provided for uploading to and downloading from AWS S3.

Release Notes: [3.7.0]

- Issue #100: configure open in admin VIs (fixed via Issue #102 & configuration file)
- Issue #101: write multiline INSERTS in chunks of 1000 rows
- Issue #102: updated PGPASS management GUI and save previous connection strings
- Issue #104: move Switch Table into private methods
- Issue #105: update Read Trace(s) to ignore NaN values
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
